data.name: Cook-Out
data.description:
“This is the kind of social videogame Oculus Quest was made for.” - VRFocus
“...offers up everything that I could ask for in an immersive VR experience." - TheGamer

Get Your Aprons Ready… Things Are About To Get Messy!

Set within the cook’s cabin of a fairytale forest, Cook-Out: A Sandwich Tale is a wacky and whimsical adventure that challenges up to four players to work together to keep the orders coming for a hungry cast of enchanted creatures in this multiplayer VR title from Resolution Games.

As players progress through increasingly hectic levels, they’ll not only prepare meals but will also need to fight off a number of nasty customers who seem absolutely set on making trouble.

With some of the game’s most recent updates, players can add to the fun by upgrading their chef’s look with the “Make it Your Way feature” and join the “House Party” update for new skins, customizations and more!

While the game is focused on cooperative play, solo players can also enjoy the experience.

changelog.change_log: * This update fixes a couple of issues with multiplayer performance
This update contains minor multiplayer bugfixes
Updating the game to support crossplay with new platforms.
Updating the game to support crossplay with new platforms.

Upgraded avatar SDK.
Fixed various bugs.

- Fixes to network stability
- Fixes to localization errors
- Various minor bug fixes

Release notes
- Oculus Avatars updated from v1 to v2
- Avatar Menu Overhauled
- Tons of new customization options for Cook-Out avatars
- Quickplay split into two categories - Just for Fun and Competitive
- Avatars can now fence, high five and fist bump!
- Support for MRC on Quest
- Endless Mode has new waves added to make it more varied
- A few new achievements

Bug fixes and stability improvements
Patch that fixes a few faulty achievements and solves a few minor bugs.

New Features:
Customize your Cook-Out avatar
- We've added lots of options for hats, shirts and gloves
- Your favorite animal avatar can now have different skin variations
- As you customize, you can have a look in the new beautiful mirror to make sure you are as fancy as you want to be

A new animal Avatar
- How to unlock it is for us to know and you to find out

Achievements
- There are now a bunch of achievements to unlock
- Some are really tricky, and by unlocking some you will unlock new customization options.

Main menu facelift
- We updated the way the main menu looks, isn't it fancy?

Bug fixes:
Fixed bugs and improved overall stability

New Features:
Animal avatars eyes are now animated

Bug fixes:
Avatar hands now syncs better over network.
Fixed occasional infinite loading on Avatars menu preventing players from choosing different avatars
Fixed broken Splash Screen on Quest
Fixed several network bugs that could cause customers and plates to break
Fixed bug that made any grabbable item disappear if a player left the game holding said item
Fixed bug preventing use of Vive Cosmos controllers

Game changes:
Valve Index controllers grip input has been tweaked to be more responsive.
Valve Index controllers now have haptics enabled.
Added another hand pose for animal avatars so it is not so easy to accidentally do an OK-sign.
Fixed an issue where avatars sometimes would enter a room frozen, broken or invisible.

Game updates:
- New animal avatars –  join the kitchen as one of six new exclusive Cook-Out avatars.
- Steam version released and cross-platform support –  Oculus and Steam VR chefs can now cook together!
Bug fixes:
- Fixed a bug related to the safety bubble system that sometimes made a player invisible until re-joining the kitchen.
- Fixed bug that caused the goals to remain after starting the final level and ending prematurely.
- Fixed a bug that was preventing the deer customer to be unlocked in creative mode.
Game changes:
- Made it slightly easier to place ingredients perfectly centered
- Slightly increased Rob-bot’s stamina
- Adjusted balancing on several customers
- Adjusted several levels to make them more balanced

Game changes
---
The holidays are now over and the Cozy Village is now back to normal. Creative Mode has now a new unique environment
Fixes
---
Various changes to network code to reduce network traffic
Fixed bug that sometimes could cause all plates to fail to spawn in Endless Mode in multiplayer
Fixed bug that sometimes could cause the pause in Endless Mode to last longer than intended in multiplayer
Fixed bug that could cause the wrong info to be displayed on the open/close room to public button in the wrist menu.
Fixed bugs related to fridge content sometimes not syncing properly in Creative Mode

Game changes
- The holiday season is here! Enjoy the snowy season with updated environments and a festive soundtrack!
- Introducing Creative mode to the game in which you are free to make any sandwiches you wish for without any time pressure. You're also able to review photos of your creations or try to discover over 140 secret recipes.
- Meet Santa and his reindeer in Creative mode and cook with new types of ingredients such as turkeys, gingerbread and candy canes!
- Updated physics - Grabbing and tossing stuff feels a lot smoother now
- Quest 2-version of the game is now on par with the Rift version with improved graphics and assets
- Quest 2 version now has 90hz refresh rate.
- Condiments now looks smoother on Rift and Quest-2 versions
- Improvements to the start menu layout, feedback and wording

Fixes
- Fixed bug that sometimes caused the grill to be turned off even when it should be on or super powered
- Fixed a multiplayer bug that sometimes caused rewards in endless mode to fail to spawn/spawn even when you had already unlocked them.
- Room codes generated when doing a group launch are now short enough to be able to input when searching for a room.
- Coin tips are now properly awarded at the end of an endless round.
- Pausing game in singleplayer now hides the customer recipes since they could be seen on Oculus Quest
- Fixed various bugs related to pausing the game
- Removed a few weird hitboxes in the menues that should never had been there
- Rebalanced the 3rd level in Carrot convention (A-03-03) that was harder than intended.
- Fixed a bug that could cause customers to fail to spawn in multiplayer games.

Cook-Out v1.2 Patch Notes
Changes
- Added a button on the wrist menu to toggle a multiplayer room between being private and public
- Player name is now displayed above each avatar, including who is the current host of the game
- Added button in the wrist menu to allow to end a round. This is possible in regular levels, endless mode and the tutorial. This can be either done in single player or when you are a host in multiplayer
- Added leaderboard support for the Endless Mode.
- Added new game hints
- Added new spawn points for the Radish Dude.
Fixes
- Fixed bug that caused rewards in endless mode to not unlock properly. Save files affected by this should be automatically restored after installing the update.
- Fixed bug that allowed the story voice over to play over itself.
- Updated the world map to make it clearer how to use it. Also added tooltip on how to replay levels on the map.
- Rebalanced a couple of early levels that were harder than intended
- Fixed bug that made it far too easy to knock off newly sliced ingredients off the table
- Minor stability fixes.
